verb.description: Feel deep respect or admiration for (something)
examples: Cézanne's still lifes were revered by his contemporaries

proper noun.description: A city in east central Massachusetts, on Massachusetts Bay, northeast of Boston; population 60,204 (est. 2008).

origin: Mid 17th century: from French révérer or Latin revereri, from re- (expressing intensive force) + vereri to fear.
